page.title: 10GELSTON CASTLE - HISTORY
page.content: Sir William Douglas,who built Gelston Castle,was born in Galloway,brought up by an uncle,and started work as a pedlar.He then emigrated to Virginia,where he made a fortune,and returned to Galloway to invest in the cotton industry. He bought a large estate in the parish of Kelton,and there erected the stately Gelston Castle The castle continued as a private home until the 1939-45 war,when it was used as a school for evacuees. After the war it was stripped of most of its fine interior,and was eventually used as a grain store. The castle is now unsafe,and people are discouraged from venturing too close. Nearby buildings on the estate have been converted to holiday flats,and there is a tennis-court and a pool.
